thread.title: What are the normal October high and low temperatures in Cleveland and Akron?
thread.title_full: What are the normal October high and low temperatures in Cleveland and Akron? | cleveland.com

author: Rich Exner, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: What are the normal October high and low temperatures in Cleveland and Akron?
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio - The calendar turning to October on Thursday signals the approach of Halloween, falling leaves and, of course, cooling temperatures.
At the beginning of the month, the normal high temperature at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport is 68 degrees.
By the final day of the month, the normal high is just 57 degrees.
Normal highs are about the same for Akron-Canton Airport.
However, evening lows this time of year are cooler at Akron-Canton - 47 degrees at the start of the month and dropping to 38 degrees on Oct. 31.
In Cleveland, the normal daily lows range from 50 degrees on Oct. 1 to 41 degrees on Oct. 31.
The charts below show the changes in normal highs and lows for Cleveland and Akron-Canton during the month of October
The normal temperatures, as determined by the National Weather Service, are based on daily readings from 1981 to 2010.
Normal October highs and lows in Cleveland This chart shows normal daily high and low temperatures for October at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport, with highs starting in the upper 60s at the beginning of the month and falling to the 50s by the end of the month, according to the National Weather Service. Rich Exner, Northeast Ohio Media Group Normal October highs and lows at Akron-Canton This chart shows normal daily high and low temperatures for October at Akron-Canton Airport, with highs starting in the upper 60s at the beginning of the month and falling to the 50s by the end of the month according to the National Weather Service. Rich Exner, Northeast Ohio Media Group
